IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: ****INCIDENT CAPTURED ON BODY WORN CAMERA #7458**** Defendant: Joshua Isai Rafailano Date Of Birth 03/25/1995 Date Of Arrest 11/10/2023 Time Of Arrest 0317 hours DUI# 23-364 Virginia Drivers License #A61398436 Narrative On Friday 11/10/2023 at approximately 0255 hours, a citizen contacted the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack, in reference to being disabled on Northbound I-495 south of Pennsylvania Ave District Heights Prince Georges County Maryland. The Duty Officer advised the driver to open Google Maps on his phone, there were multiple locations given at first. VEHICLE IN MOTION (Phase 1) At approximately 0301 hours, I, Trooper Reid #7458 of the Maryland State Police currently assigned to the Forestville Barrack (Marked MSP patrol vehicle L-27). Responded to the scene. Upon my arrival I observed a blue Toyota Corolla bearing Virginia registration UYH8584 on the right shoulder with its hazard lights on. PERSONAL CONTACT (Phase 2) Upon my initial approach to the passenger side, I observed that a tire was missing from the front right passenger side of the vehicle. The driver appeared to be driving on the rim for an unknown period of time. There was no tire on the rim. I also observed the key in the ignition and the vehicle engine was still running. The driver advised me he dialed #77 and was waiting for someone to help him. While communicating with the driver I immediately detected an odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the drivers vehicle and person. I asked the driver if he had consumed any acholic beverage prior to operating the vehicle. The driver stated No. I advised the driver to furnish his drivers license. The driver was identified by his Virginia drivers license (A61398436) as Joshua Rafailano H/M, DOB 03/25/1995. While communicating with Rafailano I observed his speech to be slurred, his eyes were bloodshot and watery, Rafailano displayed behaviors of a driver impaired by alcohol. I requested Rafailano to perform the Standardize Field Sobriety Tests at which time he agreed. PRE-ARREST SCREENING (Phase 3) The evaluation was performed on the right shoulder of Northbound I-495. The surface was dry, level and free from any debris. The weather was clear. My patrol vehicle forward emergency lights were deactivated during all three tests. Rafailano appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any visible injuries. Rafailano was asked the following questions: Glasses or Contacts - No Medical Conditions - No Injuries - No Medication - No Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus (6 of 6 clues observed) The first test was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test. The tip of my pen was used as the tests stimulus and held approximately 12 inches from Rafailano eyes. Rafailano was instructed to look straight ahead keep his head still while focusing on the tip of the stimulus with his eyes only. Rafailano was instructed to follow the tip of the pen with his eyes only until told to stop. Rafailano pupils were of equal size and showed equal tracking. Rafailano was positioned in a manner to ensure the headlights of passing traffic would not interfere with the results. 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Symbol,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Symbol,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Distinct and sustained nystagmus at maximum deviation in both eyes 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Symbol,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Onset of nystagmus prior to 45 degrees in both eyes 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Symbol,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Vertical gaze nystagmus present Walk And Turn (5 of 8 clues observed) Prior to Rafailano performing the test, I clearly explained and demonstrated how the test should be performed twice. Rafailano was instructed to place his right foot directly in front of his left foot and touch heel to toe. Rafailano was instructed and demonstrated to place his hands flat at his sides and remain in that position until told to begin. Rafailano was instructed to keep his hands flat at his sides, keep his eyes focused on his feet, and to count every step aloud. On the ninth step, Rafailano was instructed to take a series of small steps around with his rear foot to turn completely around. Rafailano was instructed that the second series of nine steps were to be formed identical to the first series of nine steps. Rafailano was instructed that once the test started, that he should not stop walking until the test was completed. Rafailano was asked if he understood my instructions of the test, and he stated, Yes. Walking Stage: 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Segoe UI,469769242:[65533,0,46],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="5" role="listitem"> Cannot keep balance 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Segoe UI,469769242:[65533,0,46],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="5" role="listitem"> Unsatisfactory turn 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Segoe UI,469769242:[65533,0,46],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="5" role="listitem"> Steps off line 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Segoe UI,469769242:[65533,0,46],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="5" role="listitem"> Incorrect number of steps 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Segoe UI,469769242:[65533,0,46],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="5" role="listitem"> Missed heel to toe One Leg Stand (2 of 4 clues observed) Prior to Rafailano performing this test, I properly explained and demonstrated to Rafailano how the test should be conducted. Rafailano was instructed to stand with his feet together and hands down by his side while I provided instructions. I explained and demonstrated to Rafailano when I told him, he was to lift a foot of his choice off the ground approximately 6 inches off the ground and make it flat and parallel to the ground. I advised Rafailano to look down at his foot, keep arms by his side and count aloud one-one thousand, two-one thousand, and so until I advised him to stop. I asked Rafailano if he understood the instructions that were given, he stated Yes. Rafailano Jr displayed the following: 1.Puts foot down 2. Swayed while balancing While on scene, Rafailano was offered and refused to submit to a Preliminary Breath Test. ARREST Rafailano was placed under arrest at approximately 0317 hours, for Driving Under The Influence Of Alcohol. Prior to transporting Rafailano to the Forestville Barrack for further processing his vehicle was towed from the scene by ANA towing to their tow facility. Rafailano was placed in the front passenger seat per department policy and transported to the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack. For the 20-minute observation period. I did not observe Rafailano regurgitate or place anything in his mouth. While at the Forestville Barracks Rafailano listen the DR 15 Advice Of Rights in Spanish audio recording. Rafailano refused to take the intoximeter examination and signed the DR 15 at 0339 hours. Rafailano was issued all the appropriate citations and explained the forthcoming process. Rafailano was transported to the Prince Georges County Department Of Corrections and placed into the custody of the facility. Charges TA-21-901.1(b)-Negligent Driving Vehicle In Careless And Imprudent Manner Endangering Property, Life And Person (13M0Y1Z) TA-21-902(a1i)-Driving Vehicle While Under The Influence Of Alcohol (13N0Y1Z) TA-21-902(b1i)-Driving Veh. While Impaired By Alcohol (13P0Y1Z) All events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland.

On November 11, 2023, at approximately 0251 hours an application for statement of charges was submitted to the commissioners office for pending approval. I applied for the following charges CR4-203(c) -Handgun In Vehicle CR 4-203(a1v)- Handgun On Person

23-MSP-039679 Supplement My body camera recorded this incident. On 11/10/2023 at approximately 1143 hours, I, Tpr Strawser #7677 responded to ANA towing located at 7820 Marlboro Pike, Forestville MD, Prince Georges County in reference to a firearm found in the vehicle of Joshua Rafailano (Blue Toyota bearing VA registration: UYH8584) who was arrested for DUI on 11/10/2023 and towed to ANAs tow lot. Upon arrival, I met with ANA employee, Glen Royoll (B/M DOB: 8/14/1967 P# 301-736-7704) who advised he was doing an inventory of Rafailanos vehicle on 11/10/2023 at approximately 1115 hours when he observed a firearm in the vehicle. Royoll stated he observed the firearm to be in between the drivers seat and the drivers door. Once in the vehicle, I observed a tan handgun tucked between the drivers seat and drivers door on the floor of the vehicle, it was later identified as a Glock 19x (Serial# BRPY233) and was within a black holster. I observed the chamber to be clear, and a magazine inserted into the firearm, there were thirteen 9mm rounds inside the magazine. A search of the vehicle rendered no further items pertaining to the firearm or other contraband. Maryland Gun Center was notified, and I made contact withInvestigator Mike Barclay #7557 who advised the firearm from above was not stolen and unregistered in Maryland. I submitted the firearm into MSP evidence. Maryland Gun Center reports, evidence forms, witness statement, and pictures the firearm were uploaded to RMS. All of the above events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland.

On November 10, 2023, TPR C. Reid #7458 of MSP Forestville Barrack contacted Joshua Isia Rafailano (DOB 03/25/1995) of Woodbridge, Virginia as the operator of a disabled vehicle in the area of the Capital Beltway and Pennsylvania Avenue, Upper Marlboro, Prince Georges County, Maryland. Based on Tpr Reids observations and investigation, Rafailano was arrested for DUI. Rafailano was transported to Prince Georges County Department of Correction where he was seen by a commissioner and released on recognizance. Tpr Strawser #7677 responded to ANA Towing, Upper Marlboro, Maryland, to contact tow lot employee reference a firearm being found in Rafailanos vehicle during an inventory conducted at the tow lot. The firearm was identified as a loaded Glock 19x 9mm SN: BRPY233. A check was conducted through the Maryland Gun Center and no additional information was located regarding the firearm. Rafailano was found to not be prohibited from possessing firearms. On November 15, 2023, I, ST S. DiToto #5416, contacted D/Sgt C. Bowling and Tpr Reid regarding their investigative efforts. It was determined no additional criminal indicators had been observed and a summons was issued and assigned to Prince Georges County Sheriffs Office for service. Troopers had no further contact with Rafailano since he was placed in the custody of PGDOC for the DUI violation. I contacted Rafailano via telephone (703-307-8389) on November 15, 2023 at approximately 1450 hours. Rafailano identified himself and was cooperative. Rafailano stated he was traveling from DC to his home in Virginia on I-495 when his vehicle became disabled and he called for assistance. He stated at the time he was carrying his loaded firearm in his vehicle for personal protection. He advised that after his release he contacted the Barrack to verify his firearm had been recovered and not stolen or lost. Rafailano stated the firearm was purchased legally by him in Virginia. He advised he possessed a Virginia Conceal Carry permit, but he did not possess a Maryland Handgun Permit. Rafailano advised he was not involved in any criminal activity. Rafailano stated he possessed the firearm case and paperwork at his residence and was able to verify the serial number and description of the handgun. Rafailano was advised of his active summons, the date/time of his preliminary hearing, and he was instructed to contact the Prince Georges County Sheriffs Office to facilitate service of the summons. No further information of value was obtained during the interview. No leads were developed and Tpr Reid was notified of the assistance provided. An OTS Test Fire will be conducted at a later date. Case closed. Above events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland.
